TopicTitle: Recoverable Randomly Generated Artifacts with Display Museum

Articles.Content:
I apologize if this has already been suggested, but to add more incentive to explore the universe, it would be great to have randomly generated (i.e. not something you can google) artifacts that can be brought back to Kerbal and placed in a new museum building at the space center.

Some more common than others, like "Mun Rock" and more rare like "Strange Jool Alien Artifact."

Smaller ones can easily brought back on kerbals, while larger ones would add mass to your lander.

Something nice to show your buddies and brag about. Just a thought!

I like it. Any additional reason for me to be going places gets my thumbs up. I haven't launched a rocket to anywhere beyond the Mun in months because I've already completed the fundamental challenge of "get to everywhere", so I have no real reason to do it anymore!

This has kind of been suggested but I think it was a little different.

Either way, I totally approve. Like the person before me, I'd love to have even more things pushing me to exploring planets, moons and asteroids. The developers have already hinted at an achievement museum type of thing so this would be an excellent addition to that.
agrred, and perhaps you would have to have a satttelite always searching, adding to the fact that you would need to put effort to finding it...
